page.title: 18OUR SCHOOL
page.content: Our school is called Lees Hill Church of England School.It is a controlled school. Before the 1950's it was an aided school.The main part of the school was built in l876. It replaced a school nearby called Crow's Gate(its remains are still evident about 200 metres to the south of the present building.)In addition there was a school at Kirkcambeck-near the entrance to Gallowberry.Kirkcambeck School was certainly there in l862 and possibly before that. Later it was used as a church (some of our old desks went there in 1876).The nearby school house was built just prior to the First World War.The present building was built as a dual purpose building:for school during school hours;for evening meetings;and for church at weekends. There is a chancel set apart for this.
